intro: Erysimum wilczekianum, commonly known as the Wilczek's wallflower, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow or orange flowers, which bloom in early spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. It is often found growing in alpine or subalpine environments.
